question: I'd like to foster but am I too old
answer: To foster you need to be older than 25. There is no upper age limit

question: How will I know I can meet the needs of a foster child
answer: Before a child is placed in your care, you and any family who lives with you, will receive education, training and support(check). When the child is placed in your home, there will also be ongoing social worker(check) support. You are not alone in fostering - there will always be support available(check).

question: I am not a Portuguese citizen, can i foster?
answer: Anyone who is a Portuguese resident can apply to foster a child(check). Once you have applied, you will go through the fostering process(LINK TO TIMELINE)

question: I don't speak Portuguese, can I still foster?
answer: Each child that is placed in a foster home will have their needs matched to an appropriate foster carer. Not speaking Portuguese will not automatically stop you from fostering(check)

question: I work full time, can I still foster?
answer: To foster a child will require time, patience, and understanding. If you work full time, you will need to think about how you can meet the needs of the child as well as your needs and those of any existing relationships. Working full time will not stop you being a foster parent, but you will need to demonstrate how you can manage everything

question: I am worried I can't afford to foster
answer: Benefits are paid to help cover the costs of raising a child. (Link to relevant info on government website)

question: What if it doesn't work - what happens then?
answer: Most fostering placements are successful(get stat). However when there are issues, a social worker and others will work with you and the child to try and improve the home situation. As a last resort, once all options have been tried and failed, the child would be removed from your home. This would be a traumatic time for all involved and social work support would be provided(check).

question: What is foster care?
answer: Foster care is a temporary protective measure for at-risk children giving them a safe, loving family environment. Children's well-being and development needs are best met withing safe and loving homes - for more information on fostering go here
